newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Lebed's guards detain, disarm Russian "tail".
newsitem.headline: Lebed's guards detain, disarm Russian "tail".

text.p: Russian security chief Alexander Lebed's bodyguards detained and disarmed several men who had been following him on Thursday, his press service said.
Lebed, who is involved in a bitter war of words with Interior Minister Anatoly Kulikov, told a news conference on Wednesday he was being followed.

The press service of President Boris Yeltsin's Security Council, of which Lebed is the secretary, said in a statement that the detained men said they had been ordered to follow Lebed by a senior interior ministry official.
Weapons and unspecified special equipment had been found on them, it said.
"A.Lebed disciplined the detainees briefly and they were released afterwards," the statement said. It gave no more details.
There was no immediate comment from the interior ministry.
Kulikov accused Lebed on Wednesday of trying to seize power by force while Yeltsin prepared for heart surgery. Lebed has dismissed the accusations and threatened to sue Kulikov.
